sentence.Network_en: He is a former defence secretary of the United States and a grandee of the Democratic Party.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是美国前国防部长，也是民主党的显要人物。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Spanish and Portuguese grande 'grand', used as a noun. The change of ending was due to association with -ee

entry.tran: 大公（旧时西班牙的最高爵位）
entry.def: In the past, a grandee was a Spanish prince of the highest rank.
You can refer to someone, especially a politician, who is upper class and has a lot of influence as a grandee .

example.ex: He is a former defence secretary of the United States and a grandee of the Democratic Party.
example.tran: 他是美国前国防部长，也是民主党的显要人物。

means.word_mean: 1. a nobleman of highest rank in Spain or Portugal
